meanings.definition: An assembly of ecclesiastics or other church delegates, convoked pursuant to the law of the church, for the discussion and decision of ecclesiastical affairs.
meanings.sent1: The synod gathered to discuss matters of the church.
meanings.sent2: The synod of bishops met to make important decisions.
meanings.sent3: At the synod, the debate over the church's new carpet color was surprisingly intense.
meanings.sent4: The synod was a beacon of unity in the sea of church politics.
meanings.sent5: I will always remember the solemn atmosphere of the synod hall.

meanings.definition: A council or assembly of church officials or churches.
meanings.sent1: The synod of elders met to plan the church's anniversary celebration.
meanings.sent2: The synod of churches worked together to organize a charity event.
meanings.sent3: The synod's bake-off competition was a hilarious disaster.
meanings.sent4: In the synod of minds, great ideas were born.
meanings.sent5: The synod of churches stood as a symbol of faith and cooperation.
